page.title: 03SOUTH INVERKIP TRANSPORT
page.content: The main communications in the area are the A78 road and the railway which runs from Glasgow to Wemyss Bay (single track from Port Glasgow). They both run from the north of the area to the south. They are both confined to the coastal areas because of the high moorlands at the back of Inverkip. Over the last few years the communications in the area have been improved with the straightening and widening of the main road which runs along the coast,and the electrification of the railway. A network of 'B' class roads links the farms. There is only one railway station in the area,at Inverkip. There is a regular bus service between Greenock and Largs,passing through Inverkip.
